title: How to use this package: Essential Workflow
text: import resources takes long, possible query database: However, functionality currently limited. need sophisticated queries, can take look documentation sofa package, allows complex queries. results can transformed functions idaifieldR.
code: pottery <- idf_query(connection, projectname = "rtest",                       field = "type",                       value = "Pottery",                      uidlist = uidlist) pottery <- idaifield_as_matrix(pottery) pottery_df <- as.data.frame(pottery) pottery_df <- type.convert(pottery_df, as.is = TRUE) head(pottery_df[,1:10]) #>        identifier    type shortDescription            processor campaign #> 1  Befund_6_KER_4 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson     2021 #> 2 Befund_6_KER_18 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson     2021 #> 3           KER_1 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson     2021 #> 4  Befund_6_KER_1 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson       NA #> 5  Befund_6_KER_8 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson     2021 #> 6  Befund_6_KER_6 Pottery             <NA> Anna Allgemeinperson     2021 #>   relation.isRecordedIn amount amountSherdsBase amountSherdsHandles #> 1             Schnitt 1      1                2                   2 #> 2             Schnitt 1      2                2                   3 #> 3             Schnitt 1      1                2                   2 #> 4             Schnitt 1     NA               NA                  NA #> 5             Schnitt 1      1                9                   2 #> 6             Schnitt 1      1                2                   3 #>   amountSherdsLid #> 1              NA #> 2              NA #> 3               0 #> 4              NA #> 5              NA #> 6              NA

title: How to use this package: Essential Workflow
text: Getting data R allows flexible create plots analysis, can re-run data available Field-Database another time. basic examples:   can basically anthing database. variables may need reformating cleaning, depending configuration state data.
code: library(ggplot2) pottery <- as.data.frame(pottery) ggplot(pottery, aes(x = relation.liesWithin)) +   geom_bar() ggplot(pottery, aes(x = specificType)) +   geom_bar() ggplot(pottery, aes(x = condition)) +   geom_bar()

title: About this package
text: project database using can either imported total (see ), queried. functions demonstrated wrapping queries possible sofa functions make accessible people using iDAI.field 2 / Field Desktop. want complex queries, suggest use sofa directly. almost function package, need “uidlist”. serves index database way replacing UIDs respective identifiers readability. can obtain uidlist / index follows: idf_query()-function, can query database fields variables. work everything: e.g. relations queried way. Another example, time querying “Farbe” radioButton field “distinguishingCriteria”: However, queries work fields one value (.e. radio Buttons, Dropdown lists, names). Sofa, searching Regular Expressions etc. possible. intend , recommend use sofa directly.
code: all_resources <- get_idaifield_docs(   connection = connection,   projectname = "rtest",   raw = FALSE ) uidlist <- get_uid_list(all_resources) layers <- idf_query(connection = connection,                      uidlist = uidlist,                     project = "rtest",                      field = "type",                      value = "Layer") layers <- idf_query(connection = connection,                      uidlist = uidlist,                     project = "rtest",                      field = "distinguishingCriteria",                      value = "Farbe")

title: About this package
text: lists usually returned database always useful easy work . functions simplify_idaifield() aims alleviate somewhat replacing UIDs identifiers, reformating coordinates make usable, spread columns multiple choice fields. processing takes time, recommend using function whole database large amount resources. Instead, try using results queries selection database obtained select_by().
code: pottery <- select_by(all_resources, by = "type", value = "Pottery") pottery <- simplify_idaifield(pottery, uidlist = uidlist) #> No Configuration found! head(idaifield_as_matrix(pottery)) #> title: About this package
text: following explanations functions longer used complete re-structuring package. However, leaving ruin day person may used point. get_idaifield_docs() imports documents project. simplified = TRUE (default) returns list already unnested resource level. simplified = FALSE possible obtain meta-info resource, .e. changelog resource. returns object class “idaifield_resources”, nested list: processing especially larger data sets, select_by() function important: list resource-types present database can gathered show_type_list(). internal names referenced types, translations may see GUI can different . can gathered Field Client “Hilfe > Formularkonfiguration” (pink names upper right corner). selection whole list can converted matrix lists: (function data.frame conversion pastes entries fields multiple entries together, recommend frankly might even work anymore, changes many things.) matrix, easy plot distributions actually select analyse data. matric can coerced data.frame easier handling plotting functions. resulting data.frame, plotting ggplot works without complications: Though may required reformat columns list character factor:
code: idaifield_test_resources <- get_idaifield_docs(   connection = connection,   projectname = "rtest",   raw = FALSE   ) idaifield_test_resources[[1]] #> $identifier #> [1] "Befund_6" #>  #> $processor #> $processor[[1]] #> [1] "Henriëtte Sönderßeichen" #>  #>  #> $campaign #> $campaign[[1]] #> [1] "2021" #>  #>  #> $id #> [1] "02932bc4-22ce-3080-a205-e050b489c0c2" #>  #> $type #> [1] "Layer" #>  #> $relation.isRecordedIn #> [1] "Schnitt 1" #>  #> $relation.liesWithin #> [1] "SE02" #>  #> $relation.liesWithinLayer #> [1] NA layers <- select_by(idaifield_test_resources, by = "type", value = "Layer") layers[[5]] #> $geometry #> $geometry$type #> [1] "Polygon" #>  #> $geometry$coordinates #> $geometry$coordinates[[1]] #>          [,1]    [,2] [,3] #> [1,] 524300.5 4153818    0 #> [2,] 524302.0 4153818    0 #> [3,] 524302.0 4153820    0 #> [4,] 524300.5 4153820    0 #>  #>  #>  #> $identifier #> [1] "Befund_1" #>  #> $id #> [1] "b6014881-d8b7-2bb6-b5df-73245374e791" #>  #> $shortDescription #> [1] "Oberfläche" #>  #> $processor #> $processor[[1]] #> [1] "Max Mustermann" #>  #>  #> $campaign #> $campaign[[1]] #> [1] "2021" #>  #>  #> $period #> $period$value #> [1] "Frühkaiserzeitlich" #>  #>  #> $type #> [1] "Layer" #>  #> $relation.isAbove #> [1] "Befund_2" "Befund_4" "Grab_1"   #>  #> $relation.isRecordedIn #> [1] "Schnitt 1" #>  #> $relation.liesWithin #> [1] "SE01" #>  #> $relation.liesWithinLayer #> [1] NA #>  #> $period.start #> [1] "Frühkaiserzeitlich" #>  #> $period.end #> [1] "Frühkaiserzeitlich" show_type_list(idaifield_test_resources) #>  [1] "Layer"           "Survey"          "Bone"            "Pottery"         #>  [5] "Mollusk"         "Trench"          "PlasterFragment" "Terracotta"      #>  [9] "Coin"            "Stone"           "Feature"         "Metal"           #> [13] "Testformular"    "Wood"            "Brick"           "Place"           #> [17] "Configuration"   "Inscription"     "Grave"           "Glass"           #> [21] "Project" pottery <- idaifield_test_resources %>%   select_by(by = "type", value = "Pottery") %>%   idaifield_as_matrix()  pottery[1:5, 1:5] #>      identifier        type      shortDescription processor              #> [1,] "Befund_6_KER_4"  "Pottery" NA               "Anna Allgemeinperson" #> [2,] "Befund_6_KER_18" "Pottery" NA               "Anna Allgemeinperson" #> [3,] "KER_1"           "Pottery" NA               "Anna Allgemeinperson" #> [4,] "Befund_6_KER_1"  "Pottery" NA               "Anna Allgemeinperson" #> [5,] "Befund_6_KER_8"  "Pottery" NA               "Anna Allgemeinperson" #>      campaign #> [1,] "2021"   #> [2,] "2021"   #> [3,] "2021"   #> [4,] NA       #> [5,] "2021" library(dplyr) pottery_df <- pottery %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   mutate_all(~ as.character(.)) head(pottery_df[, c(1, 25:29)]) library(ggplot2)  ggplot(pottery_df, aes(x = relation.liesWithin)) +   geom_bar() ggplot(pottery_df, aes(x = relation.liesWithin, fill = materialType)) +   geom_bar()

title: About this package
text: planing using coordinates geometry iDAI.field 2 / Field Desktop, strongly suggest modify digit length R importing. Depending projection used database, import might omit digits round numbers. Example:
code: options(digits = 20)

title: About this package
text: comment: simplify_idaifield() get_idaifield_docs(..., simplified = TRUE) default reformats geometry entries coordinates stored matrix. can reformatted sp-package display R-leaflet maps etc. (still need add CRS.) geometry-matrix 3 columns x, y z values. two-dimensional data database, height set 0.

title: About this package
text: case wish work whole database json-format, suggest use jsonlite package similar capabilities e.g. flatten lists output. can get whole database json format via: Since prepared package mostly suit need might happier output. functions package however probably work flattened/converted json-outputs, hard find replace UIDs etc, internal functions package may still useful.
code: connection <- connect_idaifield(serverip = "127.0.0.1",                                  user = "R",                                 pwd = "hallo") json_output <- get_idaifield_docs(projectname = "rtest",                                   connection = connection,                                   json = TRUE) library(jsonlite) nested_df <- fromJSON(json_output)$rows flattened_df <- flatten(nested_df)

title: About this package
text: Since version 3 (Field Desktop / iDAI.field 3) Configuration can extracted database. can possibly use incorporate translations plots, though yet figure way . return matrix nested lists representing whole project configuration:
code: config <- get_idaifield_docs(connection = connection,                              projectname = "rtest") %>%    select_by(by = "type", value = "Configuration")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lisa Steinmann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Steinmann L (2023). idaifieldR: Importing Data iDAI.field R. https://github.com/lsteinmann/idaifieldR, https://lsteinmann.github.io/idaifieldR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {idaifieldR: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R},   author = {Lisa Steinmann},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/lsteinmann/idaifieldR, https://lsteinmann.github.io/idaifieldR/}, }

what: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R
title: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R
text: idaifieldR imports data iDAI.field 2 / Field Desktop database R. core functions package use sofa (available CRAN) connect running iDAI.field 2 3 (Field Desktop) client store whole database list R (memory), avoiding csv-export otherwise needed gathering documents , possible said csv-export. R-Script using idaifieldR import database can re-run updated new data flexibly without exporting Field client . exports can automatically formatted easier processing R (e.g. UIDs replaced appropriate Identifiers, lists somewhat unnested, geometry reformatted usable sp-package). See Demo-Vignette info. However, processing resources database slow larger databases uses lot memory.

title: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R
text: idaifieldR depends R-package sofa (available CRAN) needs syncing iDAI.field/Field Desktop-Client computer network work.

title: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R
text: can install current version idaifieldR github using devtools remotes:
code: devtools::install_github("lsteinmann/idaifieldR", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Importing Data from iDAI.field into R
text: basic example shows use idaifieldR. See Demo.Rmd-vignette (browseVignettes("idaifieldR")), build) bit explanation. example , resources/documents project “rtest” imported single list lists. building UID-List (sort Index database) “Pottery”-resources selected: select_by_type() narrows initial list one type – Pottery example – still returns list lists. (Internal names used , translations GUI work.) next step, UIDs replaced identifiers amount unnecessary nesting reduced simplify_idaifield(). configuration available, variables checkbox-fields also converted multiple columns boolean values. can achieved querying database idf_query(). idaifield_as_matrix() produce (depending data) large matrix, every row database entry (resource) every column field, value checkbox field. matrix can easily coerced data.frame, still necessary adjust column types. (continue using iDAI.field 2, make sure add “version = 2” connection-function!)
code: library(idaifieldR) idaifield_docs <- get_idaifield_docs(projectname = "rtest",   connection = connect_idaifield(serverip = "127.0.0.1",                                  user = "R",                                   pwd = "password")) uidlist <- get_uid_list(idaifield_docs) pottery <- select_by(idaifield_docs, by = "type", value = "Pottery") pottery <- simplify_idaifield(pottery, uidlist = uidlist)  pottery_mat <- idaifield_as_matrix(pottery)  View(pottery_mat)

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs
text: Imports resources idaifield-database currently running synching list-object processing R. wraps **sofa**s functions slightly processes output. function useful import iDAI.field 2 Field Desktop respective client running computer R-script. raw = TRUE (default) allow get changes resource, .e. user changed something resource time, created . Setting raw FALSE return list actual data.

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs
code: get_idaifield_docs(   connection = connect_idaifield(serverip = "127.0.0.1", user = "R", pwd = "hallo"),   projectname = "projectname",   raw = TRUE,   json = FALSE )

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs
text: connection connection object returned `connect_idaifield()` projectname name project Field Client one wishes load. raw default FALSE. wish get unnested version resources, without metadata (.e. changes user), set TRUE json default FALSE; TRUE output simplified functions package instead list returned json format can freely manipulated using e.g. jsonlite package. (Might useful users.)

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs
text: object (list) class "idaifield_docs" (simplified = FALSE) "idaifield_resources" (simplified = TRUE) contains resources selected project. (json set TRUE, returns character string json-format.)

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs
text: NOTE: planning using coordinates stored database, strongly suggest consider changing R digits-setting higher value default. Depending projection used, coordinates may represented rather long numbers R might automatically round import. `options(digits = 20)` trick. (applies fields containing long numbers well.)

title: get_idaifield_docs — get_idaifield_docs

title: get_uid_list — get_uid_list
text: idaifield_docs object returned get_idaifield_docs verbose TRUE FALSE (= anything TRUE), TRUE returns list including identifier shorttitle convenient humans, FALSE returns UID type, enough internal selections gather_trenches defaults FALSE. TRUE, adds another column records Place corresponding Trench sub-resources lie within. (Useful grouping finds several trenches.)

title: get_uid_list — get_uid_list

title: get_uid_list — get_uid_list

Please note case internal names everything used. relabeled `Trench` `Schnitt` language-configuration, still `Trench` . None functions respect language configuration!

title: get_uid_list — get_uid_list
code: if (FALSE) { connection <- connect_idaifield(serverip = "127.0.0.1", user = "R", pwd = "hallo") idaifield_docs <- get_idaifield_docs(connection = connection, projectname = "rtest", simplified = FALSE)  uidlist <- get_uid_list(idaifield_docs, verbose = TRUE) }

code: test_2 <- list(type = "Polygon", coordinates = list(list(list(1), list(1)), list(list(1), list(2)), list(list(2), list(2)), list(list(1), list(1))))  reformat_geometry(test_2) #> $type #> [1] "Polygon" #>  #> $coordinates #> $coordinates[[1]] #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    1    1    0 #> [2,]    1    2    0 #> [3,]    2    2    0 #> [4,]    1    1    0 #>  #>

(Defaults TRUE). uidlist NULL (default) list UIDs identifiers automatically generated within function. makes sense list handed `simplify_idaifield()` selected yet. , supply data.frame returned `get_uid_list()`.

what: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
title: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
text: function unnests lists provided iDAI.field 2 / Field Desktop. actual data resource usually stored sub-list behind $doc$resource, contains data one mostly want work R. top level data contains information created modified resource time irrelevant analysis database contents .

title: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
code: unnest_docs(idaifield_docs)

title: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
text: idaifield_docs list provided `sofa::db_alldocs(...)` importing iDAI.field 2 / Field Desktop-database using `get_idaifield_docs()`. `get_idaifield_docs()` employs function already setting `simplified = TRUE`, default. Mostly need deal `unnest_docs()`. one chooses `get_idaifield_docs(..., simplified  = FALSE)`, possible use `unnest_docs()` resulting list simplify .

title: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
text: list class idaifield_resources (idaifield_docs, top-level meta-information removed make actual resource data accessible)

title: Unnesting a idaifield_docs-List down to resource level — unnest_docs
code: if (FALSE) { connection <- connect_idaifield(serverip = "127.0.0.1", user = "R", pwd = "hallo") idaifield_docs <- get_idaifield_docs(connection = connection, projectname = "rtest", simplified = FALSE)  idaifield_resources <- unnest_docs(idaifield_docs) }

title: idaifieldR 0.2.2 2023-02-18
text: config specific names now removed everywhere fixed problem -condition config exists fixed problem calculation means ranged measurements comments code places speed find_layer(), replace_uid() check_if_uid() tests

title: idaifieldR 0.2.1 2022-10-23
text: Fixed find_layer() (internal), seems work intended now. editor project configuration iDAI.field 3, new fields objects started named according configurations, e.g. “milet:temperType” etc., fields newly created. now config specific names removed fields, part double dot remains (e.g. “milet:temperType” becomes “temperType”). check_if_uid() now handles vectors Speed get_uid_list(), replace_uid(), convert_to_onehot(), fix_relations() (lot) split import get_idaifield_docs() processing usable simplify_idaifield(), advice use latter subsets time manageable. add check_and_unnest() export

title: idaifieldR 0.2.0 2022-05-15
text: Version number changed 0.2, reflect rather dramatic changes. Faster get_uid_list() using lapply() Added idf_query() specifically query db groups without first downloading everything Added idf_index_query() specifically query db things available uidlist (needs uidlist ) simplified = TRUE (simplify_idaifield()) now convert checkbox field multiple columns. probably make option future, need clean function first (TODO). make possible import configuration file (needed new functions; work idaifield3 , hopefully); connection projectname now attributes “idaifield_docs” “idaifield_resources” objects. idaifield_as_matrix() now returns matrix character values, lists Dimension lists imported single value - still stupid, actually, can’t currently think better way. Two Vignettes: Demo.Rmd essential workflow, .Rmd explaining bit . Demo.Rmd updated begin working . stated don’t intend structural changes, - apparently - impossible. Old scripts work without interference new version.

title: idaifieldR 0.1.4 2021-05-09
text: add version connect_idaifield()-function since options changed switch Field Desktop (iDAI.field 3) update documentation accordingly

title: idaifieldR 0.1.3 2021-12-07
text: Updated docs Changes geometry reformatting accommodate 3D-data (available, set 0)

title: idaifieldR 0.1.1 2021-04-13
text: First release. try limit future changes affect structural outcome core functions now. TODOs: * Find way handle remaining lists better, esp combination non-list columns. * Try assign column type automatically (numeric numbers etc.) * deal dimension…-fields (measurements)? Currently ignored, can flattened dplyr friends.

title: idaifieldR 0.1.0 2021-03-03
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Basic functions work thoroughly tested
